channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: A.N.C. Solidifies Lead in Latest South African Vote Count
item.description: With almost 98 percent of districts counted, the party led by President Jacob G. Zuma had won 62.3 percent, only slightly down from its showing in 2009.
item.dc:creator: By NORIMITSU ONISHI and ALAN COWELL

item.title: South Korea’s Leader and Media Face Scrutiny Over Ferry Disaster
item.description: Grieving families of the deceased marched on the headquarters of a major broadcaster and the offices of President Park Geun-hye.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN
item.media:description: Relatives of the high school students who were killed in the South Korean ferry disaster protested near the office of President Park Geun-hye on Friday.

item.title: Amid Tension in Ukraine, Russia Celebrates Victory Day
item.description: Some 11,000 soldiers and 150 military vehicles rumbled through Red Square, with Moscow using the parade to trumpet its recent annexation of Crimea.
item.dc:creator: By NEIL MacFARQUHAR
item.media:description: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shoigu salutes during the Victory Day parade in Moscow on Friday.

item.title: Fire Temporarily Knocks Out Broadcast Service in Kiev
item.description: The blaze and power failure came amid heightened tension in the Ukrainian capital on the anniversary of the end of World War II in Europe.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: The ‘Coming Home’ of Zhang Yimou and Gong Li
item.description: In “Coming Home,” Zhang Yimou examines China’s troubled political past and suggests how to deal with it today. With his legendary muse, Gong Li, playing the central character, the film represents a return to form for the director.
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW

item.title: India Ink: Denials Follow Latest Report on New Delhi’s Pollution
item.description: Indian government officials insist that the capital’s air pollution is not as bad as reports say.
item.dc:creator: By THE NEW YORK TIMES

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Communist Party Newspaper Denounces Detained Lawyer
item.description: The Global Times newspaper said that the lawyer, Pu Zhiqiang, had “clearly crossed the red line of law” by attending a meeting to commemorate the 1989 protest movement.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:description: Pu Zhiqiang, speaking with reporters outside the Chongqing Higher People's Court on Dec. 28, 2012.

item.title: William Ash, an Escape Artist Who Fled Toward Danger, Dies at 96
item.description: Before World War II ended, Mr. Ash had attempted 13 escapes from Nazi P.O.W. camps and made it outside the barbed wire a half dozen times.
item.dc:creator: By DOUGLAS MARTIN

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Q & A: M. Taylor Fravel on China’s Dispute With Vietnam
item.description: The timing of China’s clash with Vietnam in the South China Sea is curious given that Asia’s leaders are meeting next week and China’s actions are likely to be a main topic.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: By EDWARD WONG
item.media:description: A Chinese Coast Guard ship used water cannon on a Vietnamese Sea Guard vessel near the Paracels Islands on May 4.

item.title: India Ink: India Election Digest: May 9
item.description: A roundup of local election-related news for Friday.
item.dc:creator: By SUHASINI RAJ
item.media:description: Buddhist monks waiting outside a polling station to cast their votes in Hemis, Ladakh, on Wednesday.

item.title: Schoolgirl Abductions Put Scrutiny on U.S. Terrorism Strategy
item.description: At the heart of the issue is a debate within the Obama administration on whether it was time to officially designate Boko Haram as a “foreign terrorist organization.”
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: Deadly Illness in Nicaragua Baffles Experts
item.description: Across Central America, a disease that affects the kidneys has killed at least 20,000 people over a decade; is so poorly understood that it does not have a universally agreed upon name.
item.category: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
Chronic Kidney Disease of unknown causes
item.dc:creator: By HEATHER MURPHY
item.media:credit: Meridith Kohut for The New York Times
item.media:description: Arnulfo Téllez Aguilera, 49, a former sugar cane cutter with a mysterious kidney disease, in February. He died in March.

item.title: Police in Deadly Confrontation in Restive Chinese Region
item.description: The police in Xinjiang, the far-western Chinese region beset by ethnic tensions, fatally shot one person and captured another on Thursday, state-run media reported on Thursday.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: ‘Pinocchio Rex,’ China’s New Dinosaur
item.description: Scientists have discovered a new species of dinosaur, a relative of the ferocious Tyrannosaurus Rex, a scientific paper says. It was found in a construction site in Ganzhou in southeastern China in 2010, stuffed into bags and assembled two years later, according to local media reports.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: By DIDI KIRSTEN TATLOW
item.media:description: An artist's rendering of two Qianzhousaurus sinensis, showing the larger one chasing a small feathered dinosaur called Nankangia.

item.title: Venezuela Arrests 243 in Raids on Antigovernment Protest Camps
item.description: U.S. senators condemned the crackdown in Caracas, while local authorities said the camps had become “generators of violence” where weapons and materials for Molotov cocktails were found.
item.dc:creator: By WILLIAM NEUMAN

item.title: Ugly Words From North Korea
item.description: The state-controlled news agency directed racist and suggestive language toward President Obama and President Park Geun-hye of South Korea, who together recently issued stern warnings to North Korea.
item.dc:creator: By CHOE SANG-HUN

item.title: Ingredients of Nerve Gas Still in Syria, Official Says
item.description: The United Nations official overseeing the destruction of chemical arms said it was not yet safe to remove the remainder of materials.
item.category: Organization for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: An Explosion and a Blockade, and a Syrian Pact Is in Limbo
item.description: An insurgent group claimed responsibility for an attack on Thursday, saying it was a response to the mass killing of unarmed civilians in Aleppo.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By ANNE BARNARD and HWAIDA SAAD
item.media:description: Forces loyal to President Bashar al-Assad looked for survivors in the debris of the Carlton Hotel in Aleppo, leveled by insurgents.

item.title: World Briefing: 17 Human Rights Groups Urge Palestinians to Join World Court
item.description: A group of 17 human rights organizations including Human Rights Watch and Amnesty International on Thursday urged President Mahmoud Abbas of the Palestinian Authority to “promptly” join the International Criminal Court, a move strongly opposed by Israel and the United States.
item.category: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN

item.title: Separatists Defy Kiev and Putin on Referendum
item.description: Leaders of pro-Russian groups in eastern Ukraine said Thursday that they would proceed with the referendum, despite Russian President Vladimir V. Putin’s plea to postpone the vote.
item.dc:creator: By C. J. CHIVERS and DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
item.media:description: A polling station was prepared for the vote in Donetsk.

item.title: World Briefing: South Korea: Ferry Executive Detained
item.description: South Korean prosecutors on Thursday detained the chief executive of the company that owns the ferry that sank last month over an allegation of cargo overloading.
item.dc:creator: By THE ASSOCIATED PRESS

item.title: World Briefing : Pakistan: F.B.I. Agent Released on Bail
item.description: A Federal Bureau of Investigation agent arrested in Pakistan for trying to board a civilian flight with 15 9-millimeter bullets and a knife in his luggage was released on $10,000 bail on Thursday, Pakistani authorities said.
item.dc:creator: By REUTERS

item.title: Diplomatic Memo: In Dealings on Syria, Security Council Exposes Its Failings
item.description: The body’s paralysis over Syria has marked a new level of dysfunction, experts say, and has bolstered the arguments of those who call for a fundamental shake-up of its composition.
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: A Security Council resolution designed to get aid into Syria has failed, Valerie Amos, the United Nations relief chief, has said.

item.title: U.N. Report Documents Atrocities by Both Sides in South Sudan War
item.description: The United Nations report described horrors committed “on a massive scale,” and it is likely to boost calls for sanctions, which the United States has begun.
item.category: United Nations Department of Peacekeeping Operations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
item.dc:creator: By ISMA’IL KUSHKUSH and SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: China Flexes Its Muscles in Dispute With Vietnam
item.description: Beijing has demanded that Vietnam withdraw ships from around a Chinese drilling rig, the latest volley in an escalating standoff over parts of the South China Sea.
item.dc:creator: By JANE PERLEZ and RICK GLADSTONE
item.media:description: After using water cannons on Vietnamese ships in disputed waters, Beijing demanded Thursday that they withdraw.
